title: Britain's auditors far too male-dominated, according to industry's regulator
text:
Britain's auditors are far too male-dominated, the industry's regulator has admitted.

While around 50 per cent of those employed in the accounting industry are women, they make up just 17 per cent of partners, according to the Financial Reporting Council (FRC).

Room for improvement: The FRC found that just 4 per cent of partners at audit firms are black, Asian or of a minority ethnicity

And in even more damning data, the FRC found that just 4 per cent of partners at audit firms are black, Asian or of a minority ethnicity.

The figures will be published by the FRC in an upcoming trends report. The watchdog said it was 'ironic' that diversity in auditors is so poor, since it is these firms which advise large corporations on their own diversity and inclusion strategies.

In a separate speech in Frankfurt, the Bank of England's chief economist Andy Haldane said gender and ethnicity pay gaps are shrinking.
